name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Meets All 5 Diagnostic Criteria
description:
Meet all 5 of the following
- Inflammatory arthritis involving three or more joints
- Duration of symptoms is more than six weeks.
- Positive rheumatoid factor (RF)
- Elevated levels of C-reactive protein (CRP) or the erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)
- Diseases with similar clinical features have been excluded (crystal dz, lupus, psoriatic)

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Meets All 3 Diagnostic Criteria
description:
Meet all 3 of the below
- Presence of inflammation in at least one joint
- The absence of an alternative diagnosis that better explains the joint inflammation
- Achievement of a total score of at least 6

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Number And Site Score
shortname: Number and Site of involved joint
description:
1 Point - 2 to 10 large joints
from among shoulders, elbows, hips, knees, and ankles)
2 Points - 1 to 3 small joints
(from among the metacarpophalangeal joints, proximal interphalangeal
joints, second through fifth metatarsophalangeal joints, thumb
interphalangeal joints, and wrists
3 Points - 4 to 10 small joints
5 Points - Greater than 10 joints (including at least 1 small joint)

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Serological Abnormality Score
description:
Serological abnormality (rheumatoid factor)
0 Point – If Negative
3 Points – If Positive

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Elevated Acute Phase Response Score
description:
Elevated acute phase response (erythrocyte sedimentation rate [ESR]
or C-reactive protein [CRP]) above the ULN
0 Point – Both Not Raised 1 Point – At Least One Raised

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Symptom Duration Score
description:
Symptom Duration
0 Point – Less than 6 Weeks
1 Point – Greater than equal to 6 Weeks

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Currently Exposed to Alcohol
Rheumatoid Arthritis, Details of Current Home Medications
Rheumatoid Arthritis, Other Current Home Medications
